The past 1800 hours gave me a good opportunity to see if I liked the game. Jury is still out.

I fucking bought it early 2018 and then it became free. I think it's pretty good, it's just some of the community is quite toxic or too serious. Kinda gets tedious at times cause some matches are just fucking boring especially if you die early in the round you just kinda have to wait or possess a BOT.

I launched Counterstrike for the first time in a week, i had gotten a 7 day ban and it had just expired. I que with my friends and after the match accept was accepted my counterstrike loading screen refused to let me join. After 2 minutes I had decided to click and reatart my game. Then the game refused to open, I had to restart my computer and have another 7 day ban from playing... This is ridiculous I waited 7 days to play my favorite game and then im banned for a week again... The banning system is crazy, I hate the toxic community, all the trihards. this game has gone to complete shit since it became free and I will not be playing anymore due to smurfs and no good bastards ruining the community. Fuck this game...

I'm not that good at the game. Sometimes I rage at this game and want to break my computer. But CS just keeps bringing me back...

Are there cheaters? Yes. Is the community toxic? Not completely, but you'll probably meet a lot of people who are. 

But is it fun? Absolutely. Drunk CSGO is still my favorite thing to do. 

11/10 would get hammered and play this game again.
